body.p: The presence of surfactant at the gas-liquid interphase lowers the of the water molecules. This prevents the alveoli from collapsing during .

response.name: surface
response.feedback: Correct. Surface tension occurs because of the hydrogen bonding between water molecules. Surfactant contains phospholipids which can help disrupt the hydrogen bonding.

response.name: tension
response.feedback: Incorrect. Adhesion is the ability of water molecules to be attracted to unlike molecules and explains phenomena such as capillary action.

part.hint: The walls of the alveoli are so thin that the hydrogen bonds between water molecules need to be disrupted so the alveoli can open and close properly.

response.name: inhalation
response.feedback: Incorrect. The lack of surfactant during inhalation would result in the alveoli being harder to open or inflate. They would not collapse they would just stay closed.

response.name: exhalation
response.feedback: Correct. The lack of surfactant during exhalation can result in the alveoli collapsing once air has been expelled from them.

part.hint: The walls of the alveoli are so thin that the hydrogen bonds between water molecules need to be disrupted so the alveoli can open and close properly.
